data.title: Central Michigan University
data.meta_description: Andy Sneddon began working in the Central Michigan Athletic Communications department in March 2014. Currently he works as CMU Athletics' lead, beat writer a...
data.text:
Andy Sneddon began working in the Central Michigan Athletic Communications department in March 2014.

Currently he works as CMU Athletics' lead, beat writer and Editor-in-Chief of the official website of CMU Athletics, cmuchippewas.com, and serves as the sports communications contact for the CMU women's golf, wrestling, and baseball programs.

Prior to Central Michigan, he most recently worked as a freelance writer, with his work appearing in the Detroit Free Press, Traverse City Record-Eagle, MHSAA.com and several other Michigan newspapers and regional publications.

From 2006-12, Sneddon served as Sports Editor for the Petoskey News-Review, having previously worked as a writer for the newspaper from 1999-2006 and from 1993-97. He also wrote for the Macomb Daily in 1997-98.

Prior to his stints in Petoskey, Sneddon was the Sports Editor at the Evening News in Sault Ste. Marie (1992-93) and the Cheboygan Daily Tribune (1990-92).

During his career, Sneddon has earned more than two dozen awards from the Associated Press for feature writing, columns, game stories and sustained coverage. In 2010, while on staff as Sports Editor, the Petoskey News-Review was named Newspaper of the Year by the Michigan Press Association.

A Ferndale, Mich. native, Sneddon is a 1990 graduate of Oakland University, earning a bachelor's degree in journalism/communications.
